SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view

Class TUI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.TUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
ViewInterface
public class TUI extends Object implements ViewInterface
This class represents the Text User Interface (TUI) of the game. It is responsible for displaying game information to the player and receiving player input. The TUI communicates with the game's controller to send player actions and receive updates about the game state. It also uses the game's model to retrieve information about the game state for display. The TUI is designed to be used in a console environment. It implements the ViewInterface interface, which defines the methods that every type of view should implement.

    • receiveChatMessage

      public void receiveChatMessage(String sender, String message, boolean broadcast)
      Displays a received chat message to the player. This method is called when a chat message is received from another player. It takes the sender's nickname and the message content as parameters, and displays the message to the console.
      Specified by:
      receiveChatMessage in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      sender - The nickname of the player who sent the message.
      message - The content of the message.
      broadcast - A boolean indicating whether the message is a broadcast message.

      Specified by:
      showStartingCardChosen in interface ViewInterface

    • showCommonTable

      public void showCommonTable()
      Displays the common table of cards to the player. 2 resource cards, 2 gold card and the cards on the deck. This method is called to show the current state of the common table of cards in the game. It retrieves the cards from the model and prints them to the console for the player to view.
      Specified by:
      showCommonTable in interface ViewInterface

    • showSecretObjectiveCardsToChoose

      public void showSecretObjectiveCardsToChoose(Integer[] objectiveCardIds)
      Displays the secret objective cards that the player can choose from. This method retrieves the secret objective cards from the model, converts them into a printable format, and then prints them to the console for the player to view and choose from.
      Specified by:
      showSecretObjectiveCardsToChoose in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      objectiveCardIds - An array of IDs of the secret objective cards that the player can choose from.

    • showSecretObjectiveCard

      public void showSecretObjectiveCard(int indexCard)
      Prints the secret objective card of the player. This method takes an index of a card as input, retrieves the corresponding card and prints the representation of the card on the console. The representation of the card is an array of strings, with each string representing a row of the card.
      Specified by:
      showSecretObjectiveCard in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      indexCard - The index of the secret objective card to print.

    • stopGaming

      public void stopGaming()
      Informs the player that the game has ended due to a client disconnection. This method is called when a client has disconnected from the game and the game cannot continue. It displays a message to the console indicating that the game has ended and thanks the player for playing.
      Specified by:
      stopGaming in interface ViewInterface

    • askNumberOfPlayers

      Specified by:
      askNumberOfPlayers in interface ViewInterface

    • askChooseColor

      public void askChooseColor()
      This method is responsible for asking the user to choose a color for their player. The user is presented with a list of colors to choose from, and their input is read from the console. The chosen color is then sent to server. If the user enters an invalid input, they are asked to choose a color again.

    • showHiddenHand

      public void showHiddenHand(String name)
      Shows the hidden hand of a player.
      Specified by:
      showHiddenHand in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player.

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the game's Text User Interface (TUI). This method is responsible for starting the game's TUI. It is called when the game is about to start. It continuously runs a loop to keep the game running until it ends. Inside the loop, it displays the default menu to the user and handles their input.

    • printCardArray

      public void printCardArray(ArrayList<String[]> cardsToPrint)
      Prints an array of cards. This method takes an ArrayList of String arrays, where each String array represents a card, and prints each card to the console. Each String in the array represents a row of the card. The cards are printed row by row, with each card's row printed side by side.
      Parameters:
      cardsToPrint - An ArrayList of String arrays, where each String array represents a card to be printed.

    • fromKingdomToCard

      public PlayedCard fromKingdomToCard(Kingdom kingdom)
      It is used to create a card to print when we only know the kingdom, not the card. It is used for the deck.
      Parameters:
      kingdom - the kingdom of the card
      Returns:
      the card to print

    • createCardToPrint

      public String[] createCardToPrint(PlayedCard card)
      Return the card of the player. This method takes an index of a card as input, retrieves the corresponding card and prints the representation of the card on the console. The representation of the card is an array of strings, with each string representing a row of the card.
      Parameters:
      card - The playedCardToPrint of the card to print.
      Returns:
      The representation of the card as an array of strings.

    • signToEmoji

      public String signToEmoji(String sign)
      This method is responsible for converting a sign to its corresponding emoji. It takes a string representation of a sign as input and returns a string representation of the corresponding emoji. The method handles the following signs: MUSHROOM, WOLF, BUTTERFLY, LEAF, SCROLL, INKWELL, QUILL, EMPTY, NULL. If the sign is not one of the above, the method returns a string with two spaces.
      Parameters:
      sign - The sign to be converted to an emoji. It is a string representation of a sign.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the corresponding emoji. If the sign is not handled by the method, it returns a string with two spaces.

    • setModel

      public void setModel(LittleModel model)
